title: CES 2026 opens with AI stepping into physical world
contents: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, over 4,500 companies showcased AI transitioning from software to physical embodiment, with Samsung and LG competing to become everyday AI companions through connected devices and robots. Samsung aims to embed AI across 400 million devices annually, while LG demonstrated its autonomous home robot CLOiD powered by affectionate intelligence.

title: SK AX wins government approval for AI skills certification
contents: South Korean company SK AX won government accreditation for its AI Competency Certification Platform under Korea's Corporate Qualification Program, validating the generative AI-focused system used by 3,800 SK Group employees. The platform assesses real-world job performance through AI-powered lifecycle processes rather than theoretical knowledge.

title: “이미 물량 꽉 찼다” TSMC 2나노 초기 생산...대만 2개 팹서 가동
contents: TSMC announced plans to begin mass production of its N2 chip technology from two Taiwanese factories in Q4 2025, featuring next-generation GAA transistors with 10-15% power efficiency improvements over its N3 process. The company will gradually increase N2 capacity to 100,000 wafers monthly by late 2026 as orders surge from major AI customers.

title: 딥엑스, CES 2026서 ‘5W 미만 초저전력 LLM 추론’ 전략 DX-M2 로드맵 공개
contents: MediaTek subsidiary Deepak unveiled the DX-M2 AI chip roadmap at CES 2026, delivering 100-billion-parameter large language model inference using under 5 watts of power. The second-generation on-device AI processor aims to decentralize generative AI from data centers to edge devices like robots and industrial equipment.

title: 노르딕, nRF54L·엣지 AI 랩으로 '대규모 IoT 온디바이스 AI' 구현 간소화
contents: Nordic Semiconductor launched ultra-low-power edge AI solutions including the nRF54LM20B SoC with integrated Axon NPU and Neuton AI models for IoT devices. The chip enables millisecond-latency on-device intelligence for battery-constrained applications like wearables and smart sensors without cloud connectivity.

title: Ceva, 보스반도체 차세대 ADAS 플랫폼에 AI DSP 공급
contents: Semiconductor startup BOS Semiconductors' Eagle-A ADAS chip integrates Ceva's SensPro AI DSP for optimized sensor data processing from cameras, LiDAR, and radar. The chiplet-based architecture allows automakers to flexibly adjust computing performance for autonomous driving systems while processing real-time multi-sensor data efficiently.

title: Alexa+ comes for ChatGPT's web turf
contents: Amazon launched Alexa.com, a web-based interface bringing its AI-powered Alexa+ assistant to compete with ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude for the first time beyond devices. The assistant includes agentic capabilities with integrations from Expedia, Yelp, and Square, with user engagement surging 3-5x since Alexa+ rollout.

title: 2026년 메모리 시장 “HBM이 이끄는 메모리 슈퍼사이클에 주목”
contents: The global semiconductor market is experiencing a 'super cycle' in 2026 with memory chips driving 30% of growth, as SK Hynix positions itself as the only supplier producing both HBM3E and next-generation HBM4 technologies. The HBM market is projected to reach $546 billion in 2026, a 58% increase, with HBM-focused AI chip demand surging.

title: 팀스파르타, 2025년 AI 오프라인 교육 매출 전년 대비 2.5배 ↑
contents: Korean IT startup Tumspark grew its corporate AI offline training revenue over 2.5x year-over-year in 2025, shifting focus from knowledge-based to practical AI application for enterprises. The company trains 20,000 employees annually with specialized curricula targeting specific industry needs, achieving 4.6/5 satisfaction scores.
